sn12.45:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying at Nādika in the brick house.
sn12.45:1.3: Then while the Buddha was in private retreat he spoke this exposition of the teaching:
sn12.45:2.1: “Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.45:2.2: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.45:2.3: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.45:2.4: Craving is a condition for grasping. …
sn12.45:2.5: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.45:3.1: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds. …
sn12.45:3.2: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the nose and smells. …
sn12.45:3.3: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the tongue and tastes. …
sn12.45:3.4: Body consciousness arises dependent on the body and touches. …
sn12.45:3.5: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and thoughts. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.45:3.6: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.45:3.7: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.45:3.8: Craving is a condition for grasping. …
sn12.45:3.9: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.45:4.1: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.45:4.2: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.45:4.3: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.45:4.4: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn12.45:4.5: When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases. …
sn12.45:4.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.45:5.1: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds. …
sn12.45:5.2: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and thoughts. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.45:5.3: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.45:5.4: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.45:5.5: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn12.45:5.6: When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases. …
sn12.45:5.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
sn12.45:6.1: Now at that time a certain monk was standing listening in on the Buddha.
sn12.45:6.4: “Monk, did you hear that exposition of the teaching?”
sn12.45:6.9: That exposition of the teaching is beneficial and relates to the fundamentals of the spiritual life.”
